moves.3. c4: Trying to gain control of the centre
moves.12... a5 13. Bd3 b5 14. Rf3: Preparing to attack the weak king side.. only the knight is in defence
moves.14... Be7 15. Qf2 Ng4 16. Qg3 b4 17. Ne2: Waiting for white to commit to a line of action
moves.18. Nf5 Bxf5 19. Bxf5 Nf6 20. Qh4 g6: Forced pawn advance gives access to h6 for the white queen..black pieces are helpless on his queen-side
pxN followed by Bxp would pin the knight at d7 and open the g file. White knight threatens Nxe7, winning the queen
moves.25... Re8 26. Nxe7+: Removes a strong defensive piece..Bf8 would have removed control of h6 for white
moves.26... Rxe7 27. f5: Trying to open up the pawn-structure
moves.27... Nf8 28. fxg6 Nxg4: Should have played Qxg4 (followed by 29.Qxg4 Nxg4 30.pxh7ch Nxh7 31.Rg3 Nh7-f6 32.Bf5) forcing exchange of queens and removing a mate threat but losing a minor piece
moves.29. gxh7+ Nxh7: A very bad move..only possible move to avoid mate was 29. .. Kh8 30.Bf5 losing the knight
